correct_order: Employers are often reluctant to hire young people, even though there are more than 850,000 unemployed 16 to 24-year-olds and UK businesses are struggling to fill one in five vacancies because of skills shortages.
They are skeptical about young people’s skills and their readiness for work.
But a growing number of companies are setting up schemes to recruit young workers.
They can be surprised by the results.
